clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Exercise Training Programs On Balance in Older Adults With CVD
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Exercise Training Programs - Stability and Coordination - On Static Balance, Dynamic Balance and Risk of Falls in Older Adults With Cardiovascular Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Individuals of advanced age with cardiovascular disease are at higher risk of fall.The aim of this study is to explore the effect of specific exercise program based on balance and coordination on stability parameters

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Balance ability - a composite outcome
primary_outcome.description: In order to assess changes in balance ability, it will be measured with the following tests: Timed Get Up and Go , Balance Error Scoring System Test, Functional Reach Test, before and after the 12 week physical activity program and the difference will be compared

arm_group.description: A physical activity program that is based on balance and coordination exercises
A physical activity program that is based on strength exercises

intervention.description: Participants will take part in a biweekly, 12 week physical activity program that will include balance and coordination exercises
Participants will take part in a biweekly, 12 week physical activity program that will include traditional strength exercises

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has Cardiovascular disease, under the supervision of a cardiologist
- Participates in a cardiovascular rehabilitation center
- Able to undergo physical activity for 60 minutes twice a week
Exclusion Criteria:
- All Other
